business.headline: Gold prices soar to all-time high, Rupee hits record low ahead of festive seasonAhead of the festive season, prices for precious metals have hit record highs while the Indian rupee has fallen to an all-time low. Gold crossed the ₹1,04,000 per 10 grams mark, and silver leaped past ₹1,20,000 per kilo, driven by tariff uncertainties and safe-haven demand.

Shampoos, TVs, hybrid cars to get cheaper as government plans GST cutThe biggest reform of the goods and services tax system in nearly a decade comes amid strained trade ties with the US, with PM Modi making repeated calls for increased use of Indian products.

Adani Defence to join race for AMCA stealth fighter jet contractThe AMCA project is being led by the Aeronautical Development Agency (ADA), which functions under the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO).

India's GST collection rises 6.5% in August to Rs 1.86 lakh croreGST growth was highest in Sikkim (39%), Meghalaya (35%) and Nagaland (33%). Among big states, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu and UP posted 9–15% gains.

Paytm clarifies on Google Play alert, no issues with Paytm UPIPaytm noted that this transition is part of its migration to new UPI handles after receiving approval from the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) to operate as a Third Party Application Provider (TPAP).
Sensex closes 554 points higher, Nifty above 24,600; Mahindra gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 554.84 points to close at 80,364.49, while the NSE Nifty50 added 198.20 points to close at 24,625.05.

Can India rely on China to counter Trump's 50% tariff shock?With US tariffs hitting 50% and Indian exporters scrambling, turning to China may seem tempting. But the strategic and economic risks are real. But can India really rely on China as trade tensions escalate with the US after Donald Trump's tariff tsunami?

Is India profiting from Russian oil? Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri explainsUS President Donald Trump recently announced new tariffs on exports in an effort to discourage India's oil imports from Russia.

How to avoid a 'defective' ITR filing, explains tax expertFiling your income tax return is more than just declaring income and paying taxes. Missing key disclosures can make your ITR "defective" and even attract steep penalties, warns tax expert.
Sensex gains 500 points: Why is stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex was up 529.17 points to 80,338.82, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 185.20 points to 24,612.05 as of 2:15 pm.

Looking for higher FD returns? These small finance banks offer up to 7.77%If you're hunting for better fixed deposit returns, small finance banks are offering rates as high as 7.77%, outpacing larger lenders. Here's a look at some of the top options.

Rupee falls to all-time low of 88.33 against US dollar amid tariff woesThe fall also came as investors reacted to the recent move by the United States to raise tariffs on goods, which has added to concerns over India's trade and fiscal outlook.

entertainment.headline: Sonu Sood to Shilpa Shetty, Bollywood celebs extend support to Punjab flood victimsPunjab is battling one of its worst flood crises, leaving thousands displaced and homes destroyed. Celebrities like Sonu Sood, Sanjay Dutt, Shilpa Shetty, and Himanshi Khurana have stepped forward with prayers, support, and aid for the affected families.

Ram Kapoor shares towel selfie on 52nd birthday, says he feels youngerRam Kapoor celebrated his 52nd birthday with a towel selfie. He flaunted his 50-kilo weight loss and saying he feels healthier and younger than in 25 years.

Sumona Chakravarti alleges car mobbed by Maratha protesters, raises safety concernsActor Sumona Chakravarti shared that her car was mobbed in broad daylight by Maratha quota protesters in South Mumbai, leaving her feeling unsafe and vulnerable. She criticised the lack of police presence and called the incident a mockery of law, order, and civic responsibility.

Saloni Chopra slams alleged abuser Zain Khan Durrani's casting in Songs of ParadiseActor and filmmaker Saloni Chopra has criticised Prime Video's 'Songs of Paradise' for casting her alleged abuser Zain Khan Durrani, whom she had accused of violence during the MeToo movement in 2018.

Anushka Shetty opens up about violence in Ghaati, promises more films aheadAnushka Shetty's light-hearted banter with Rana Daggubati turned into a candid reveal, as she spoke about choosing stronger scripts and appearing more often on screen.

Alia Bhatt enjoys Ganesh Chaturthi with mother-in-law Neetu Kapoor, relishes modaksAlia Bhatt shares intimate moments from her Ganesh Chaturthi celebration with Neetu Kapoor, highlighting family warmth and upcoming film projects.

Ajith Kumar asks for 13-year-old racing prodigy Jaden Immanuel's autographTamil actor Ajith Kumar, who turned professional racer in 2025, recently met Jaden Immanuel, a 13-year-old MotoGP racer from Chennai competing in Germany, and asked the young racer for his autograph.

Tanya Mittal wants to be next Kartik Aaryan, says enough of playing strong woman'Bigg Boss 19' contestant Tanya Mittal, an entrepreneur-turned-influencer from Gwalior, is already making waves in Salman Khan's reality show. In an interview with us, she promises fearless opinions, viral moments, and a clear dream of becoming the next superstar after Kartik Aaryan.

Don't wanna say goodbye: Sharon Osbourne reacts to husband Ozzy's deathSharon Osbourne has publicly acknowledged the death of her husband Ozzy Osbourne, reacting to a heartfelt tribute posted on his official Instagram. The legendary singer died after battling Parkinson's disease.

Riddhima Kapoor on debut film with Neetu Kapoor, Kapil Sharma: Happened so suddenlyRiddhima Kapoor makes her acting debut alongside mother Neetu Kapoor in a heartfelt family film. The project highlights rare mother-daughter chemistry and a close-knit cast experience in Shimla.

Dhanashree is manifesting love after divorce with Yuzvendra ChahalChoreographer Dhanashree Verma spoke about manifesting love after her divorce from cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal during a chat with filmmaker Farah Khan. She also shared that their relationship remains cordial.

Avneet Kaur breaks silence on Virat Kohli viral moment: I try not to get distractedAvneet Kaur has finally spoken up about the recent Virat Kohli Instagram 'like' that sent social media into a frenzy. The actor-influencer, who enjoys a massive online following, said she refuses to get distracted by such viral chatter.

Exclusive: John Abraham's Tehran director doubts his survival in BollywoodArun Gopalan's 'Tehran' challenges typical Bollywood spy films with a sensitive political story. The film highlights the India-Iran-Israel conflict while focusing on human perspectives beyond politics.

Bigg Boss 19's Abhishek Bajaj wedding photos with Akansha Jindal go viral'Bigg Boss 19' contestant Abhishek Bajaj is married. He got married to Akanksha Jindal in 2017. Their wedding photos have been removed from their social media profiles, but are now going viral.

Salakaar director explains why attention is the real currencyDirector Faruk Kabir opened up about his espionage thriller series 'Salakaar'. In an exclusive chat, he said that in today's digital age, attention has become the most valuable currency.

Actor Soubin Shahir denied permission to attend Dubai event amid fraud caseActor Soubin Shahir has been denied permission to travel abroad after the Ernakulam Magistrate Court rejected his plea to attend an award show in Dubai.

Soni Razdan recalls losing work after marrying Mahesh Bhatt: I was so angryActor Soni Razdan reflected on the challenges she faced in the film industry, especially after marriage. She was last seen on 'Birds of Paradise', streaming on Prime Video.

Your Name: The body-swap love story by Makoto Shinkai that changed anime foreverIn this week's Animania, we discuss how Makoto Shinkai's 'Your Name' became a global phenomenon, blending romance, comedy, and tragedy into the anime that turned him into a household name.

Director Nag Ashwin on Kalki 2898 AD sequel's production: Everyone is busyThe director of 2024's blockbuster film 'Kalki 2898 AD', Nag Ashwin, spoke about the timeline for the highly anticipated sequel to the Prabhas, Amitabh Bachchan and Deepika Padukone-starrer. The second part is yet to go on floors.

general news.headline: India offered zero tariffs, but it's late: Trump's big claim after PM-Putin meetDonald Trump reiterated unsubstantiated claims against India, calling trade a "one-sided disaster" and alleging that New Delhi had offered to cut tariffs to zero, but said it was too late.

Rahul Gandhi says will drop 'vote chori hydrogen bomb', BJP calls it dudRahul Gandhi said Prime Minister Modi will not be able to face the people after the Congress party's 'hydrogen bomb' on vote chori.

Dinner with PM, special seminar: NDA's strategy for 100% voting in Veep electionThe NDA is preparing for the Vice Presidential election on 9 September, aiming for full participation of its MPs. Their strategy includes workshops, state monitoring, and securing additional support to increase vote share.

Ride or die: PM Modi, Putin make a statement with carpoolPrime Minister Narendra Modi and Russian President Vladimir Putin shared a ride in a 'made in Russia' Aurus sedan to their bilateral meeting in Tianjin, with Modi later calling the exchange "insightful" in a post on X. The gestures highlighted the depth of India-Russia ties ahead of their bilateral talks.

Trump's attack dog chases Brahmins, Indian Boston Brahmins bark up wrong treePresident Trump's senior aide Peter Navarro latched on to Brahmins to attack India's oil purchase from Russia. He meant Boston Brahmins said a chunk of India's chattering class. They twisted themselves into pretzels to defend him to show Indians that be it a caste tree or a class tree, it's all fair as long as it aligned with their dissent tree.

Reading between SCO visuals: Modi-Xi-Putin huddle, Shehbaz's blank gaze, and moreOn the final day of the SCO summit, the pictures spoke louder than words. A one-and-a-half-minute huddle between Modi, Putin, and Xi became a defining moment, leaving other leaders watching with curiosity.

Modi-Xi Jinping meet: For India, why dialogue with China vital but deterrence indispensableBeyond the 'positive momentum' underlined in the interaction held alongside the SCO Summit in Tianjin, India's security establishment views the engagements with China as part of a cautious balancing act

Shampoos, TVs, hybrid cars to get cheaper as government plans GST cutThe biggest reform of the goods and services tax system in nearly a decade comes amid strained trade ties with the US, with PM Modi making repeated calls for increased use of Indian products.

Is Trump trying to sow chaos in India?There is a definite pattern to the terms being used by Trump administration functionaries, including Peter Navarro, to attack India and PM Modi. Trump cronies are directly addressing Indians and trying to exploit the country's caste and class fault lines. This after the US injected chaos into Bangladesh.

Day 9 Live Updates:  De Minaur vs Riedi underway, Rublev vs Felix up nextUS Open 2025 Day 9 Live Updates: Alex de Minaur is currently up against Switzerland's Leandro Riedi in the first match of the day. Andrey Rublev will be up against Felix Auger-Aliassime on Centre Court. Later in the day, Iga Swiatek, Coco Gauff, Amanda Ansimova and Jannik Sinner will be in action.

Clear roads by tomorrow: Court to Manoj Jarange as quota stir chokes Mumbai trafficMaratha activist Manoj Jarange Patil has been pressing for a 10 per cent quota and declared that he would not leave Mumbai until the demand is met. The protest entered its fourth day on Monday.

Jagdeep Dhankhar vacates Veep residence, moves to private farmhouseFormer Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar moved to a private residence in Chhatarpur after vacating official quarters. He awaits the completion of his new government-allotted bungalow.

Avneet Kaur breaks silence on Virat Kohli viral moment: I try not to get distractedAvneet Kaur has finally spoken up about the recent Virat Kohli Instagram 'like' that sent social media into a frenzy. The actor-influencer, who enjoys a massive online following, said she refuses to get distracted by such viral chatter.

Dirty political game: Mamata Banerjee fumes after Army removes protest stageThe temporary structure was removed by the Indian Army. The demonstrations were held at the site to protest against the alleged atrocities on Bengali-speaking migrant workers in BJP-ruled states.

Can India rely on China to counter Trump's 50% tariff shock?With US tariffs hitting 50% and Indian exporters scrambling, turning to China may seem tempting. But the strategic and economic risks are real. But can India really rely on China as trade tensions escalate with the US after Donald Trump's tariff tsunami?

Brahmin, not Boston Brahmin: Did Opposition school Opposition on Navarro remark?Priyanka Chaturvedi said that while she was aware of the "Boston Brahmins" reference in the US, the invocation of the term in India's context by a senior White House adviser carried a different and deliberate political weight.

Exclusive: John Abraham's Tehran director doubts his survival in BollywoodArun Gopalan's 'Tehran' challenges typical Bollywood spy films with a sensitive political story. The film highlights the India-Iran-Israel conflict while focusing on human perspectives beyond politics.

How women with risqué content have India reelingSocial media shorts and Instagram Reels are creating dangerous friction in Indian society. The technology of the 21st century is clashing with the mores of a society still in the 19th century. While men opt for risky, women are getting into risque and vulgar content in an economy where eyeballs convert to hard cash. The Nikki Bhati case is just the tip of the iceberg. Here's how Indian society is reeling from the reel-making tornado.

Trump sacrificed India ties for family's Pak deals: Ex-US NSA Jake SullivanUS President Donald Trump has sacrificed India ties for his family's business deals with Pakistan, said Biden-era NSA Jake Sullivan. In an outright conflict of interest, the Trump family is involved in a crypto venture in Pakistan even as the US President mollycoddles Pakistani army chief Asim Munir. The US should have boosted technology, talent and economic ties with India, said Sullivan.

How India's 7.8% Q1 GDP growth has strong rural Bharat rootsQ1 FY25-26 numbers signal an Indian economy firing on multiple engines and rural demand surge providing a cushion against global trade shocks caused by Donald Trump's tariff war

Millennials and Gen Z make culture the hottest travel trend of 2025Travel trends are shifting again and Indian travellers are all set to soak in the immersive cultural diversity. 7 in 10 travellers are excited to explore international and local festivals, traditions and heritage.

800 dead, over 2,800 injured: Decoding Afghanistan's deadly earthquakeThis region lies at the convergence of the Indian and Eurasian tectonic plates, which are continuously pushing against each other at a rate of approximately 39 millimetres per year.

One who can fool is best leader: Nitin Gadkari says truth discouraged in politicsUnion minister Nitin Gadkari stirred debate with his remarks, saying the leader who can best fool people often succeeds, though he stressed that honesty, credibility and truth ultimately remain the most important values in society.

Educate Girls is first Indian NGO to win Magsaysay Award | Full story in 5 pointsAn Indian NGO, Educate Girls, has scripted history by becoming the first Indian non-profit organisation to win the prestigious Ramon Magsaysay Award 2025, often dubbed Asia's Nobel Prize. The honour recognises the transformative work of the NGO, which has so far enroled over 2 million girls and improved learning outcomes for 2.4 million children across 30,000 Indian villages.

sports.headline: Alexander Isak to Liverpool sealed in record transfer deal for Newcastle: ReportsLiverpool have reportedly ended the long-running transfer saga by signing Alexander Isak from Newcastle United for a British record 125 million pounds. The Swedish striker becomes the Premier League's most expensive player ever after completing his move to Anfield.

Day 9 Live Updates: Alex de Minaur vs Leandro Riedi to kick off actionUS Open 2025 Day 9 Live Updates: Alex de Minaur will be up against Switzerland's Leandro Riedi in the first match of the day. Andrey Rublev will be up against Felix Auger-Aliassime on Centre Court. Later in the day, Iga Swiatek, Coco Gauff, Amanda Ansimova and Jannik Sinner will be in action.

India to host Badminton World Championships 2026 in New Delhi after 17 yearsThe Badminton World Championships will return to New Delhi in August 2026, marking India's second time hosting the event after 17 years. The duo of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty fetched India's only medal in the 2025 edition in Paris.

Iran hand harsh reality check to India with 3-0 humbling in CAFA Nations CupIndia's bright start under Khalid Jamil ended with a 3-0 loss to Iran at the CAFA Nations Cup. The defeat exposed India's gaps against Asia's elite ahead of their crucial clash with Afghanistan.

Asia Cup: China, Korea join India in Super 4s, Malaysia rout Chinese TaipeiChina secured a hard-fought draw against Japan while Korea secured a big win over Bangladesh to join India and Malaysia in the Super 4 stages of the Asia Cup. Malaysia routed Chinese Taipei 15-0 to go into the next round with a 100 percent record.

England vs South Africa ODI series : Squads, all you need to knowENG vs SA: England and South Africa will contest a three-match ODI series in September 2025 across UK venues. The series promises competitive cricket with both sides fielding strong squads and key players under fitness watch.

Bayer Levekusen sack Erik ten Hag after only 2 Bundesliga games in chargeBayer Leverkusen's decision to sack Erik ten Hag after just two Bundesliga matches marks the fastest dismissal in league history, capping a nightmare week for ex-Manchester United managers alongside Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and Jose Mourinho.

Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma not getting farewell was shocking: Ravi BishnoiRavi Bishnoi expressed disappointment over the sudden retirement of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma from Test cricket. He hopes they receive a proper farewell as Indian cricket enters a new phase under Shubman Gill.

Maaya Rajeshwaran storms into Round 2, heartbreak for Hitesh, TyagiMaaya Rajeshwaran marked her Grand Slam main-draw debut with a straight-sets win to enter the US Open girls' singles second round. Meanwhile, Kriish Tyagi and Hitesh Chauhan exited early.

MS Dhoni, Gautam Gambhir as mentor-coach pair will be worth watching: Manoj TiwaryThe possible reunion of MS Dhoni and Gautam Gambhir in India's coaching setup for the T20 World Cup 2026 could blend tactical brilliance with championship experience, promising a coaching partnership that cricket fans worldwide will eagerly watch.

MS Dhoni, Gautam Gambhir as mentor-coach pair will be worth watching: Manoj TiwaryThe possible reunion of MS Dhoni and Gautam Gambhir in India's coaching setup for the T20 World Cup 2026 could blend tactical brilliance with championship experience, promising a coaching partnership that cricket fans worldwide will eagerly watch.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
